metadata.name: Potential CommandLine Path Traversal Via Cmd.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects potential path traversal attempt via cmd.exe. Could indicate possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\cmd.exe')) AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\cmd.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('cmd.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower('/c')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower('/k')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower('/r'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/c')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/k')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/r'))) AND lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line) = lower('/../../') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/../../')) AND NOT contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\\\tasktop\\\\keycloak\\\\bin\\\\/../../jre\\\\bin\\\\java')))

output.summary: Detects potential path traversal attempt via cmd.exe. Could indicate possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

metadata.objective: False positive: Java tools are known to produce false-positive when loading libraries References: https://hackingiscool.pl/cmdhijack-command-argument-confusion-with-path-traversal-in-cmd-exe/, https://twitter.com/Oddvarmoe/status/1270633613449723905
